analyzed: sumatiḥ pramatiḥ dīptiḥ samākhyātaḥ mahaḥ mahān

analyzed: caturdaśā ete manavaḥ kīrtitā kīrti varddhanāḥ

translated: Brahma spoke to Daksha, who was near Bhava and Dharma:

analyzed: dakṣa kanyā tava iyam vai janayiṣyati suvratā
translated: O Daksha, this daughter of yours, Suvrata, will give birth

translated: Having heard the words of Brahma, Daksha, Dharma and Bhava,

translated: With bodies newly born, unable to enjoy,

translated: seeing them self-arisen, uttering the words of Brahma,

analyzed: ruceḥ prajāpateḥ putraḥ raucyaḥ nāma abhavat sutaḥ

analyzed: savarṇāyāḥ sutaḥ ca anyaḥ smṛtaḥ vaivasvataḥ manuḥ
translated: Another Manu, the son of Savarṇā, is remembered as Vaivasvata.

translated: in the future, for the accomplishment of all tasks.

analyzed: prathame merusāvarṇe dakṣa putrasya vai manoḥ
translated: In the first Manvantara of Dakṣa's son Manu Merusāvarṇi,

analyzed: parāmarīcigarbhāḥ ca sudharmāṇaḥ ca te trayaḥ
translated: there were three: Parā, Marīci, and Garbha, and Sudharmā.

analyzed: saṃbhūtāḥ ca mahātmānaḥ sarve vaivasvata intare
translated: All of them were born in the Vaivasvata Manvantara.

analyzed: dakṣaputrasya putrāḥ te rohitasya prajāpateḥ
translated: The sons of Daksha's son, the Prajapati Rohita,

analyzed: bhaviṣyanti bhaviṣyāḥ tu ekaikaḥ dvādaśaḥ gaṇaḥ
translated: will be the future ones, each group consisting of twelve.

analyzed: aiśvaraḥ ca grahaḥ rāhuḥ vākuḥ vaṃśaḥ tathā eva ca
translated: The planet Aishvara, Rahu, and the dynasty of Vakula,

analyzed: pārāḥ dvādaśa vijñeyāḥ uttarān tu nibodhata
translated: the twelve southern (lunar mansions) should be known. Now listen to the northern (lunar mansions).

analyzed: vājipaḥ vājijit ca eva prabhūtiḥ ca kakudī atha
translated: Vajibha, Vajibha, Prabhu, Kakud,

analyzed: dadhikrāvā vipakvaḥ ca praṇītaḥ vijayaḥ madhuḥ
translated: Dadhikrava, Vippaka, Pranita, Vijaya, Madhu,

analyzed: utathya uttamakau dvau tu dvādaśā ete marīcayaḥ
translated: Utathya, and Uttamaka - these twelve are Marichi's sons.

analyzed: sudharmāṇaḥ tu vakṣyāmi nāmataḥ tān nibodhata
translated: I will tell you the names of the Sudharmans. Listen to them.

analyzed: varṇaḥ tathā atha garviḥ ca bhuraṇyaḥ vrajanaḥ mitaḥ
translated: Varna, Athagari, Bhurannya, Vrajana, Amit,

analyzed: amitaḥ dravaketuḥ ca jaṃbho śakrakaḥ
translated: Amit, Dravaketu, Jambha, Aja, Shakraka,

analyzed: sunemiḥ dyutayaḥ ca eva sudharmāṇaḥ prakīrtitāḥ
translated: Sunemi, and Dyuti - these are declared to be Sudharmans.

analyzed: teṣām indraḥ tadā bhāvyaḥ hi adbhutaḥ nāma nāmataḥ
translated: Their Indra will be Adbhuta by name.

analyzed: skando sau pārvatīyaḥ vai kārtikeyaḥ tu pāvakiḥ
translated: That Skanda is Parvatya, Kartikeya is Pavaki,

original: medhātithiśca paulastyo vasuḥ kāśyapa evaṃ ca // / / //
analyzed: medhātithiḥ ca paulastyaḥ vasuḥ kāśyapaḥ evam ca

analyzed: jyotiṣmān bhārgavāḥ ca eva dyutimān aṅgirāḥ tathā
translated: Jyotishmat of the Bhargava race, Dyutimat of the Angirasa race,

analyzed: vasinaḥ ca eva vāsiṣṭhaḥ ātreyaḥ havyavāhanaḥ
translated: Vasishtha of the Vasishtha race, Havya-vahana of the Atri race,

analyzed: sutapāḥ paulahaḥ ca eva saptā ete rohitetare
translated: Sutapa of the Pulaha race, these seven are the sons of Rohita.

analyzed: dhṛtiketuḥ dīptiketuḥ śāpahasta nirāmayāḥ
translated: Dhruti-ketu, Dipti-ketu, Shapa-hasta, Niram-aya,

analyzed: pṛthuśravāḥ tathā anīkaḥ bhūridyumnaḥ bṛhat yaśaḥ
translated: Prithu-shrava, An-ika, Bhuri-dyumna, Briha-dyumna,

analyzed: prathamasya tu sāvarṇeḥ nava putrāḥ prakīrtitāḥ
translated: The nine sons of the first Savarni Manu are thus declared.

original: daśame tvatha paryāye dharmaputrasya vai manoḥ /
analyzed: daśame tu atha paryāye dharmaputrasya vai manoḥ
translated: In the tenth cycle, in the age of Dharma-putra Manu,

analyzed: dvītīyasya tu sāvarṇeḥ bhāvyasya eva antare manoḥ
translated: In the second age of Savarni Manu, Bhava's Manu,

original: sudhāmāno viruddhāśca dvāveva tu gaṇau smṛtau /
analyzed: sudhāmānaḥ viruddhāḥ ca dvau eva tu gaṇau smṛtau

original: dīptimantaśca te sarve śatasaṃkhyāśca te samāḥ // / / //
analyzed: dīptimantaḥ ca te sarve śata saṃkhyāḥ ca te samāḥ

analyzed: prāṇānām yat śatam proktam ṛṣibhiḥ puraṣa iti vai
translated: The sages have declared that the hundred vital airs in man are the men.

analyzed: devāḥ te vai bhaviṣyanti dharmaputrasya vai manoḥ
translated: They will become the gods of Dharma-putra Manu.

analyzed: teṣām indraḥ tathā vidvān bhaviṣyaḥ śāntiḥ ucyate
translated: Among them, the learned Bhaviṣya Śānti is declared to be Indra.

analyzed: haviṣmān paulahaḥ śrīmān sukīrtiḥ ca atha bhārgavaḥ
translated: Havishmat of the Pulaha race, the prosperous Sukirti of the Bhargava race,

analyzed: āpomūrtiḥ tathā ātreyaḥ vasiṣṭhaḥ ca āpavaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: The embodiment of water, Atri, Vashishtha, and Apva are remembered.

analyzed: paulastyaḥ pratimaḥ ca api nābhāgaḥ ca eva kāśyapaḥ
translated: Paulastya, Apratima, Nabhaga, and Kashyapa,

analyzed: abhimanyuḥ ca aṅgirasaḥ saptā ete parama ṛṣayaḥ
translated: Abhimanyu of the Angiras lineage - these seven are the supreme sages.

analyzed: sukṣetraḥ ca uttamaujāḥ ca bhūrisenaḥ ca vīryavān
translated: Suksetu, Uttamauja, and the valiant Bhurisena,

analyzed: śatānīkaḥ nirāmitraḥ vṛṣasenaḥ jayadrathaḥ
translated: Shatanika, Niramitra, Vrishasena, Jayadratha,

analyzed: bhūridyumnaḥ suvarcāḥ ca daśā ete mānavāḥ smṛtāḥ
translated: Bhuridyumna, and Suvarcha - these ten are known as human.

original: ekādaśe tu paryāye sāvarṇe vai tṛtīyake /
analyzed: ekādaśe tu paryāye sāvarṇe vai tṛtīyake
translated: In the eleventh cycle, the third of Savarni,

analyzed: nirvāṇa ratayaḥ devāḥ kāmagāḥ vai manaḥ javāḥ
translated: the gods are Nirvanarata, capable of going anywhere at will, and swift as thought.

analyzed: gaṇāḥ tu ete trayaḥ khyātāḥ devātānām mahātmanām
translated: These three groups are known as the great gods.

analyzed: ekaikaḥ triṃśataḥ teṣām gaṇaḥ tu tridivaukasām
translated: Each group of the gods of heaven consists of thirty.

original: māsasyāhāni triṃśattu yāni vai kavayo viduḥ /
analyzed: māsasya ahāni triṃśat tu yāni vai kavayaḥ viduḥ
translated: The wise know the days of a month to be thirty.

analyzed: nirvāṇa ratayaḥ devāḥ rātrayaḥ tu vihaṅgamāḥ
translated: The gods are Nirvanarata, and the nights are the birds.

analyzed: gaṇaḥ tṛtīyaḥ yaḥ prokte devatānām bhaviṣyati
translated: The third group of gods that will be mentioned,

analyzed: manojavāḥ mūrūrttāḥ tu iti devāḥ prakīrtitāḥ
translated: the gods known as Manovaga and Muruta.

original: ete hi brahmaṇaḥ putrā bhaviṣyā mānavāḥ smṛtāḥ /
analyzed: ete hi brahmaṇaḥ putrāḥ bhaviṣyāḥ mānavāḥ smṛtāḥ
translated: These are the sons of Brahman, known as the future Manus.

original: teṣāmidro vṛṣā nāma bhaviṣyaḥ surarāṭ tataḥ // / / //
analyzed: teṣām idraḥ vṛṣā nāma bhaviṣyaḥ surarāj tatas
translated: Among them, Indra will be named Vrisha, and after him, the king of the gods.

analyzed: teṣām sapta ṛṣīn ca api kīrtyamānān nivaudhata
translated: Listen now to the names of the seven Rishis of that age, as they are being recited.

analyzed: haviṣmān kāśyapaḥ ca api vapuṣmān ca eva bhārgavaḥ
translated: Havishmat, the son of Kashyapa, Vapu-man, the son of Bhrigu,

original: āruṇiśca tathātreyo vasiṣṭho naga eva ca /
analyzed: āruṇiḥ ca tathā ātreyaḥ vasiṣṭhaḥ nagaḥ eva ca
translated: Atreya, the son of Atri, Vasishtha, Naga,

analyzed: puṣṭiḥ āṅgirasaḥ jñeyaḥ paulastyaḥ niścaraḥ tathā
translated: Pushti, the son of Angiras, and Niscara, the son of Pulastya.

analyzed: paulahaḥ hi atitejaḥ ca devāḥ hi ekādaśa intare
translated: In the eleventh cycle, the gods will be Paulastya, Attitaisha,

analyzed: sarvavegaḥ sudharmā ca devānīkaḥ purovahaḥ
translated: Sarva-vega, Sudharma, Dev-anika, Puro-vaha,

analyzed: kṣemadharmā graheṣuḥ ca ādarśaḥ paiṇḍrakaḥ maruḥ
translated: Kshema-dharma, Grahesh, Adarsh, Paindara, and Maru.

original: sāvarṇasya tu te putrāḥ prājāpatyasya vai nava // / / //
analyzed: sāvarṇasya tu te putrāḥ prājāpatyasya vai nava
translated: These nine sons of Savarni, the son of Prajapati, will be the Manus.

original: dvādaśe tvatha paryāye rudraputrasya vai manoḥ /
analyzed: dvādaśe tu atha paryāye rudra putrasya vai manoḥ
translated: In the twelfth cycle, the Manu will be the son of Rudra.

analyzed: caturthaḥ rudrasāvarṇaḥ devān tasya antare śṛṇu
translated: The fourth Manu will be Rudra-Savarni. Listen to the names of the gods of his age.

analyzed: pañca eva tu gaṇāḥ proktāḥ devatānām anāgatāḥ
translated: Five classes of gods are mentioned, who are yet to come.

analyzed: haritāḥ rohitāḥ ca eva devāḥ sumanasaḥ tathā
translated: The Haritas, the Rohitas, the gods Sumanas,

analyzed: sukarmāṇaḥ sutaraḥ ca vidvān ca eva sahasradaḥ
translated: Sukarman, Sutara, Vidvan, Sahasrada,

analyzed: parvataḥ nu caraḥ ca eva apāśuḥ ca manaḥ javaḥ
translated: Parvata, Anucha, Apashu, Manojava,

original: ūrjā svāhā svadhā tārā daśete haritāḥ smṛtāḥ /
analyzed: ūrjā svāhā svadhā tārā daśā ite haritāḥ smṛtāḥ
translated: Urja, Svaha, Svadha, Tara, these ten are known as Haritas.

original: tapo jñānī mṛtiścaiva varcā bandhuśca yaḥ smṛtaḥ // / / //
analyzed: tapaḥ jñānī mṛtiḥ ca eva varcāḥ bandhuḥ ca yaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: Tapa, Jnanin, Mrityu, Varchas, the one remembered as Bandhu,

analyzed: rajaḥ ca eva tu rājaḥ ca svarṇapādaḥ tathā eva ca
translated: Raja, Rajas, Svarnapada,

original: puṣṭirvidhiśca vai devā daśaite rohitāḥ smṛtāḥ // / / //
analyzed: puṣṭiḥ vidhiḥ ca vai devāḥ daśā ete rohitāḥ smṛtāḥ
translated: Pushti, Vidhi, these ten gods are remembered as Rohitas.

analyzed: tuṣta ādyāḥ tu ye devāḥ trayaḥ triṃśat prakīrtitāḥ
translated: The gods beginning with Tushta are proclaimed as thirty-three.

original: te vai sumanaso vedyānnibodhata sukarmaṇaḥ // / / //🔽suparvā vṛṣabhaḥ pṛṣṭā kapidyumnavipaścitaḥ /
analyzed: te vai sumanasaḥ vedyān nibodhata sukarmaṇaḥ  su parvā vṛṣabhaḥ pṛṣṭā kapi dyumna vipaścitaḥ
translated: Know them to be of good minds, of good deeds.🔽Suparva, Vrishabha, Prstha, Kapidymna, Vipschita,

original: vikramaśca kramaścaiva vibhṛtaḥ kānta eva ca // / / //
analyzed: vikramaḥ ca kramaḥ ca eva vibhṛtaḥ kāntaḥ eva ca
translated: Vikrama, Krama, Vibhrit, and Kanti,

analyzed: ete devāḥ su karmāṇaḥ sutarān ca nibodhata
translated: these gods are of good deeds. Know the Sutaras.

analyzed: varṣaḥ divyaḥ tathā añjiṣṭhaḥ varcasvī dyutimān kaviḥ
translated: Varsha, Divya, Anjishtha, Varchasi, Dyumati, Kavi,

analyzed: śubhaḥ haviḥ kṛtaprāptiḥ vyāpṛtaḥ daśamaḥ tathā
translated: Shubha, Havi, Kritaprapti, Vyaprita, the tenth,

analyzed: sutārāḥ nāmataḥ tu ete devāḥ vai saṃprakīrtitāḥ
translated: these gods are proclaimed by name as Sutaras.

analyzed: teṣām indraḥ tu vijñeyaḥ ṛta dhāmā mahā yaśāḥ
translated: The Indra of those (gods) was known as Rta-dhama, of great fame.

analyzed: dyutiḥ vasiṣṭha putraḥ tu ātreyaḥ sutapāḥ tathā
translated: Dyuti was the son of Vasishtha, and Atreya was Sutapas.

analyzed: tapomūrtiḥ tu āṅgirasaḥ tapasvī kāśyapaḥ tathā
translated: Tapomurti was the son of Angiras, and Tapasvi was the son of Kashyapa.

analyzed: tapodhanaḥ ca paulastyaḥ paulahaḥ ca taporatiḥ
translated: Tapोधन was the son of Paulhasti, and Paulha was Taporati.

analyzed: bhārgavaḥ saptamaḥ teṣām vijñeyaḥ tu tapodhṛtiḥ
translated: The seventh of them was Bhargava, who should be known as Tapodhriti.

analyzed: ete sapta ṛṣayaḥ siddhāḥ antye sāvarṇika iṃtare
translated: These seven sages were Siddhas in the last Savarnika Manvantara.

analyzed: devavān upadevaḥ ca devaśreṣṭhaḥ vidūrathaḥ
translated: Devavata, Upadeva, Devashrestha, Viduratha,

analyzed: mitravān mitrasenaḥ tha citrasenaḥ hi amitra hā
translated: Mitravata, Mitrasena, Chitrasena, Amitrahan,

analyzed: mitrabāhuḥ suvarcāḥ ca dvādaśasya manoḥ sutāḥ
translated: Mitrabahu, and Suvarcha were the sons of the twelfth Manu.

analyzed: trayodaśe tu paryāye bhāvye raucye intare punar
translated: In the thirteenth cycle, in the future Raucya Manvantara,

original: traya eva gaṇāḥ proktā devānāṃ tu svayaṃbhuvā /
analyzed: trayaḥ eva gaṇāḥ proktāḥ devānām tu svayaṃbhuvā
translated: three groups of gods were declared by the Self-Existent One.

original: brahmaṇo mānasāḥ putrāste hi sarve mahātmanaḥ // / / //
analyzed: brahmaṇaḥ mānasāḥ putrāḥ te hi sarve mahātmanaḥ
translated: They were the mental sons of Brahma, all of them great souls.

analyzed: sutrāmāṇaḥ sudharmāṇaḥ sukarmāṇaḥ ca te trayaḥ
translated: They were the three groups of Sutrāmaṇas, Sudharmans, and Sukarmans.

analyzed: tridaśānām gaṇāḥ proktāḥ bhaviṣyāḥ soma pāyinām
translated: They were declared the groups of the thirty-three gods who will drink Soma in the future.

analyzed: trayastriśat devatāḥ yāḥ pṛthak ijyāḥ tu yājñikaiḥ
translated: The thirty-three deities who are to be worshipped separately by the sacrificers,

analyzed: ājyena pṛṣadājyena grahaśreṣṭena ca eva ha
translated: with ghee, with mixed ghee, and also with the best cup.

original: ye vai devāstrayastriṃśatpṛthaktvena nibodhata /🔽sutrāmāṇaḥ prayājyāstu ājyāśā ye tu sāṃpratam // / / //
analyzed: ye vai devāḥ trayastriṃśat pṛthaktvena nibodhata  su trāmāṇaḥ prayājyāḥ tu ājya āśāḥ ye tu sāṃpratam
translated: Those who are the thirty-three gods, understand them separately.🔽The Sutramāṇas are to be offered with the Prayājas, and those who are now the recipients of ghee.

analyzed: su karmāṇaḥ nuyājyā ākhyāḥ pṛṣadājya āśinaḥ tu ye
translated: The Sukarmas are called Anuyājyās, and those who partake of mixed ghee.

analyzed: upayājyāḥ sudharmāṇaḥ iti devāḥ prakīrttitāḥ
translated: The Upayājyās are of good conduct, thus the gods are proclaimed.

analyzed: divaspatiḥ mahā satvaḥ teṣām indraḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: The lord of heaven, of great strength, will be their Indra.

analyzed: pulaha ātmaja putrāḥ te vijñeyāḥ tu ruceḥ sutāḥ
translated: They should be known as the sons of the son of Pulaha, the sons of Ruchi.

analyzed: aṅgirāḥ ca eva dhṛtimān paulastyaḥ pi avyayaḥ tu saḥ
translated: Aṅgiras is also the wise one, and the son of Pulastya is indeed the imperishable one.

analyzed: paulahaḥ tattvadarśī bhārgavaḥ ca nirupsukaḥ
translated: The son of Pulaha is the seer of truth, and the son of Bhārgava is the one without desire.

analyzed: niṣprakaṃpyaḥ tathā ātreyaḥ nirmohaḥ kāśyapaḥ tathā
translated: The son of Atri is unshakable, and the son of Kaśyapa is free from delusion.

analyzed: sutapāḥ ca eva vāsiṣṭhaḥ saptā ete tu trayodaśa
translated: The son of Vasiṣṭha is Sutapas, these seven are the thirteen.

original: citraseno vicitraśca nayo dharmo dhṛto bhavaḥ /
analyzed: citrasenaḥ vicitraḥ ca nayaḥ dharmaḥ dhṛtaḥ bhavaḥ
translated: Citrasena, Vicitra, Naya, Dharma, Dhṛta, Bhava,

analyzed: anekaḥ kṣatra viddhaḥ ca surasaḥ nirbhayaḥ daśa
translated: Aneka, Kṣatravid, Surasas, and Nirbhaya are the ten.

original: raucyasyaite manoḥ putrā hyantare tu trayodaśe /
analyzed: raucyasya ete manoḥ putrāḥ hi antare tu trayodaśe
translated: These are the sons of Manu Raucya in the thirteenth aeon.

analyzed: caturdaśe tu paryāye bhautyasya api antare manoḥ
translated: In the fourteenth cycle, in the aeon of Manu Bhautya,

original: devatānāṃ gaṇāḥ pañca proktā ye tu bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: devatānām gaṇāḥ pañca proktāḥ ye tu bhaviṣyati
translated: the five groups of gods that are said to exist in the future,

analyzed: cākṣuṣāḥ ca pavitrāḥ ca kaniṣṭhāḥ bhrājitāḥ tathā
translated: the Chakshushi, the Pavitra, the Kanishtha, the Bhrashita,

original: vācāvṛddhāśca ityete pañca devagaṇāḥ smṛtāḥ /🔽niṣādādyāḥ svarāḥ sapta sapta tānviddhi cākṣuṣān // / / //
analyzed: vācāvṛddhāḥ ca iti ete pañca deva gaṇāḥ smṛtāḥ  niṣāda ādyāḥ svarāḥ sapta sapta tān viddhi cākṣuṣān
translated: and the Vachashriddhas - these are remembered as the five groups of gods.🔽Know the seven notes beginning with Ni-shada as the Chakshushi,

analyzed: bṛhat ādyāni sāmāni kaniṣṭhān sapta tān viduḥ
translated: the seven Sama hymns beginning with Brihat as the Kanishtha,

analyzed: sapta lokāḥ pavitrāḥ te bhrājitāḥ sapta siṃdhavaḥ
translated: the seven worlds as the Pavitra, the seven rivers as the Bhrashita,

analyzed: vācāvṛddhān ṛṣīn viddhi manoḥ svāyabhuvasya ye
translated: and the sages of Manu's Svayambhuva aeon as the Vachashriddhas.

analyzed: sarve manvantara idrāḥ ca vijñeyāḥ tulya lakṣaṇāḥ
translated: All the lords of the Manvantaras should be known to have similar characteristics,

analyzed: tejasā tapasā vuddhyā bala śruta parākramaiḥ
translated: in terms of their energy, austerity, intellect, strength, learning, and valor.

original: trailokye yāni sattvāni gatimanti dhruvāṇi ca // / / //
analyzed: trailokye yāni sattvāni gatimanti dhruvāṇi ca
translated: In the three worlds, all the beings, whether mobile or immobile,

analyzed: sarvaśas sarvaiḥ guṇaiḥ tāni indrāḥ te bhibhavanti vai
translated: are surpassed by the Indras in every way, in all their qualities.

analyzed: bhūta apavādinaḥ hṛṣṭāḥ madhyasthāḥ bhūta vādinaḥ
translated: Those who censure beings are delighted, while those who speak in favor of beings are neutral.

analyzed: bhūta abha vādinaḥ śaktāḥ trayaḥ vedāḥ pravādinām
translated: The three Vedas, beginning with the Bhūta, are capable of proclaiming the doctrines of the learned.

analyzed: agnīdhraḥ kāśyapaḥ ca eva paulastyaḥ māgadhaḥ ca yaḥ
translated: Agnīdhra, Kāśyapa, the one of Pulastya, and the one of Magadha,

analyzed: bhārgavaḥ hi agnivāhuḥ ca śuciḥ āṅgirasaḥ tathā
translated: Bhārgava, Agnivāhu, and also Śuci, Āṅgirasa,

original: śukraścaiva tu vāsiṣṭhaḥ paulaho mukta eva ca // / / //
analyzed: śukraḥ ca eva tu vāsiṣṭhaḥ paulahaḥ muktaḥ eva ca
translated: Śukra, and Vasiṣṭha, and the one of Pulaha, and the one who is liberated,

analyzed: ātreyaḥ śvājitaḥ proktaḥ manu putrān atas śṛṇu
translated: Ātreya is said to be Śvājit. Listen to the sons of Manu.

original: ururguruśca gaṃbhīro buddhaḥ śuddhaḥ śuciḥ kṛtī // / / //
analyzed: uruḥ guruḥ ca gaṃbhīraḥ buddhaḥ śuddhaḥ śuciḥ kṛtī
translated: Uru, Guru, Gambhīra, Buddha, Śuddha, Śuci, Kṛtī,

analyzed: ūrjasvī subalaḥ ca eva bhautyasya ete manoḥ sutāḥ
translated: Ūrjasvī, and Subala, these are the sons of Manu Bhautya.

original: sāvarṇā manavo hyete catvāro brahmaṇaḥ sutāḥ // / / //
analyzed: sāvarṇāḥ manavaḥ hi ete catvāraḥ brahmaṇaḥ sutāḥ
translated: These are the Sāvarṇa Manus, the four sons of Brahmā.

analyzed: ekaḥ vaivasvataḥ ca eva sāvarṇaḥ manuḥ ucyate
translated: But one is called Sāvarṇa Manu, the son of Vivasvat.

original: raucyo bhautyaśca yau tau tu matau paulahabhārgavau /
analyzed: raucyaḥ bhautyaḥ ca yau tau tu matau paulaha bhārgavau
translated: The two, Raucya and Bhautya, are considered to be of Pulaha and Bhārgava.

analyzed: bhautyasya eva ādhipatye tu tūrṇam kalpaḥ tu pūryate
translated: In the overlordship of Bhautya alone, the Kalpa is quickly fulfilled.

analyzed: sūtaḥ uvāca
translated: Sūta said:

analyzed: niḥśeṣeṣu tu sarveṣu tadā manvantareṣu iha
translated: But when all the Manus of the Manvantaras are completely destroyed,

analyzed: ante na eka yuge tasmin kṣīṇe saṃhāraḥ ucyate
translated: at the end of that many-yuge, the dissolution is said to occur.

original: saptaite bhārgavā devā ante manvantare tadā // / / //
analyzed: sapta ete bhārgavāḥ devāḥ ante manvantare tadā
translated: These seven Bhārgavas are the gods in the last Manu period.

analyzed: bhuktvā yuga ākhyāḥ hi ekasaptatīḥ
translated: Having enjoyed the three worlds for seventy-one yugas,

analyzed: pitṛbhiḥ manubhiḥ sārddham kṣīṇe manvantare tadā
translated: when the Manu period is exhausted along with the manes and Manus,

original: anādhāramidaṃ sarvaṃ trailokyaṃ vai bhaviṣyati /🔽tataḥ sthānā ni śubhrāṇi sthānināṃ tāni vai tadā // / / //
analyzed: anādhāram idam sarvam trailokyam vai bhaviṣyati  tatas sthānā ni śubhrāṇi sthāninām tāni vai tadā
translated: this entire three worlds will become without support.🔽Then those bright abodes of the gods will be empty,

analyzed: vimuktāni tārāḥ ṛkṣa grahaiḥ tathā
translated: the stars, constellations and planets will fall, released.

analyzed: tatas teṣu vyatīteṣu trailokyasya īśvareṣu iha
translated: Then, when those lords of the three worlds have passed away,

analyzed: saṃprapteṣu mahar lokam yasmin te kalpa vāsinaḥ
translated: having attained the Maharloka, where those who dwell for a kalpa,

analyzed: ajita ādyāḥ gaṇāḥ yatra āyuṣmantaḥ caturdaśa
translated: the victorious and other groups, and the fourteen long-lived ones,

analyzed: manvantareṣu sarveṣu devāḥ te vai caturddaśa
translated: in all the Manu periods, those fourteen gods,

original: sa sraṣṭā sarvabhūtānāṃ kalpādiṣu punaḥ punaḥ /
analyzed: sa sraṣṭā sarva bhūtānām kalpa ādiṣu punar punar
translated: He is the creator of all beings again and again in the beginning of the kalpas.

analyzed: tu hi ātmani eva prajāpatiḥ
translated: Thus Prajapati, having slept in himself,

analyzed: atha ātmani mahā tejāḥ sarvam ādāya sarva kṛt
translated: then in himself, the greatly radiant one, the doer of all, taking everything,

original: tataḥ sa vasate rātriṃ tamasyekārṇave jale // / / //
analyzed: tatas sa vasate rātrim tamasi ekārṇave jale

analyzed: tatas rātri kṣaye prāpte prati buddhaḥ prajāpatiḥ

analyzed: evam sa loke nirvṛttaḥ upaśānte prajāpatau
translated: Thus, when Prajapati has withdrawn from the world and become tranquil,

analyzed: brāhme naimittike tasmin kalpite vai prasaṃyame

analyzed: dehaiḥ viyogaḥ sattvānām tasmin vai kṛtsnaśas smṛtaḥ

analyzed: tatas dhagdheṣu bhūteṣu sarveṣu āditya raśimabhiḥ

analyzed: gandharva ādīni sattvāni piśāya antāni sarvaśas

analyzed: kalpa ādau aprataptāni janam eva āśrayanti vai

analyzed: tiryagyonīni narake yāni yāni gatāni api
translated: Those that have gone to the animal realm and even to hell,

analyzed: tadā tāni āpi dagdhāni dhūta pāpāni sarvaśas

analyzed: jale tāni upapadyante yāvat saṃplavate jagat

analyzed: vyuṣṭāyām ca racanyām tu brahmaṇaḥ vyakta yonitaḥ
translated: And when the creation is completed, from the unmanifest source of Brahma,

analyzed: jāyante hi punar tāni sarva bhūtāni kṛtasnaśas
translated: all beings are born again, completely.

analyzed: ṛṣayaḥ manavaḥ devāḥ prajāḥ sarvāḥ caturvidhāḥ
translated: The sages, Manus, gods, and all four types of beings,

analyzed: teṣām api ca siddhānām nidhana utpattiḥ ucyate

analyzed: yathā sūryasya loke smin udaya astamane smṛte
translated: Just as the rising and setting of the sun are remembered in this world,

analyzed: tathā janma nirodhaḥ ca bhūtānām iha dṛśyate
translated: so the birth and cessation of beings is seen here.

original: ābhūtasaṃplavāttasmādbhavaḥ saṃsāra ucyate /🔽yathā sarvāṇi bhūtānāṃ jāyante varṣaṇeṣviha // / / //
analyzed: ā bhūtasaṃplavāt tasmāt bhavaḥ saṃsāraḥ ucyate  yathā sarvāṇi bhūtānām jāyante varṣaṇeṣu iha
translated: Therefore, from the time of the universal dissolution, existence is said to be the cycle of birth and death.🔽Just as all beings are born in the rains here,

analyzed: sthāvara ādīni niyamāt kalpe kalpe tathā prajāḥ
translated: so the beings, beginning with the immobile, are born in every Kalpa, by rule.

analyzed: yathā ārttau ṛtu liṅgāni nānā rūpāṇi paryaye
translated: As the various forms of distress are seen in the seasons, in succession,

analyzed: dṛśyante tāni tāni eva tathā brahmadyu rātriṣu
translated: so are those very things seen in the days and nights of Brahman.

original: pratyāhāre visarge ca gatimanti dhruvāṇi ca // / / //
analyzed: pratyāhāre visarge ca gatimanti dhruvāṇi ca
translated: In the withdrawal and creation, the moving and fixed things

original: niṣkramante viśante ca prajāḥ kāle prajāpatim /
analyzed: niṣkramante viśante ca prajāḥ kāle prajāpatim
translated: enter and emerge from Prajapati at the proper time.

analyzed: brahmāṇam sarva bhūtāni mahā yogam maheśvaram
translated: All beings enter and emerge from Brahman, the great yogi, the great lord.

original: sa sraṣṭā sarvabhūtānāṃ kalpādiṣu punaḥ punaḥ /
analyzed: sa sraṣṭā sarva bhūtānām kalpa ādiṣu punar punar
translated: He is the creator of all beings again and again in the beginning of the kalpas.

original: vyakto 'vyakto mahādevastasya sarvamidaṃ jagat // / / //🔽yenaiva sṛṣṭāḥ prathamaṃ prayātā āpo hi mārgeṇa mahītale 'smin /
analyzed: vyaktaḥ vyaktaḥ mahādevaḥ tasya sarvam idam jagat  yena eva sṛṣṭāḥ prathamam prayātāḥ āpaḥ hi mārgeṇa mahī tale smin
translated: The manifest and unmanifest Mahadeva, to him belongs this entire universe.🔽By whom alone, having first gone, the waters proceeded on this earth by the path,

analyzed: pūrvam prayātena yathā tu atha apaḥ tena eva tena eva tu svar vrajanti
translated: just as they go to heaven by that very same path.

original: yathā śūbhena tvaśubhena caiva tatraiva tatraiva vivarttamānāḥ /
analyzed: yathā śūbhena tu aśubhena ca eva tatra eva tatra eva vivarttamānāḥ
translated: As the mortals, revolving right there, right there, by the good and the bad,

analyzed: martyāḥ tu deha antara bhāvita tvāt raveḥ vaśāt ūrdhvam adhas caranti
translated: move upwards and downwards due to the influence of the sun, because of the change in the state of the body.

original: ye cāpi devā manavaḥ prajeśā anye 'pi ye svargagatāśca siddhāḥ /
analyzed: ye ca api devāḥ manavaḥ prajā īśāḥ anye ye svarga gatāḥ ca siddhāḥ
translated: And those gods, Manus, Prajapatis, and others who have attained heaven and perfection,

original: tadbhāvitāḥ khyātivaśāśca dharmyāḥ punarvisargeṇa bhavanti sattvāḥ // / / //
analyzed: tad bhāvitāḥ khyāti vaśāḥ ca dharmyāḥ punar visargeṇa bhavanti sattvāḥ
translated: And being thus influenced, they again become beings by the process of re-creation.

analyzed: atas ūrdhvam pravakṣyāmi kālam ābhūtasaṃplavam
translated: From here onwards I shall describe the time up to the dissolution of the world.

analyzed: manvantarāṇi yāni syuḥ vyākhyātāni mayā dvijāḥ
translated: O Brahmins, I have explained the Manvantaras,

original: saha prajānisargeṇa saha devaiścaturddaśa /🔽sā yugākhyā sahasraṃ tu sarvāṇyevāntarāṇi vai // / / //
analyzed: saha prajā nisargeṇa saha devaiḥ caturddaśa  sā yuga ākhyā sahasram tu sarvāṇi eva antarāṇi vai
translated: along with the creation of beings and the fourteen gods.🔽That is called a thousand yugas, and all the intermediate periods,

original: asyāḥ sahasre dva pūrṇa viśeṣaḥ kalpa ucyate /
analyzed: asyāḥ sahasre dva pūrṇa viśeṣaḥ kalpa ucyate
translated: in this thousand, the two full special Kalpas are said to be.

original: etadbrāhmamaharjñeyaṃ tasya sakhyāṃ nibodhata // / / //🔽nimeṣatulyamātrā hi kṛtā labdakṣaṇena tu /

analyzed: mānuṣa akṣi nimeṣāḥ tu kāṣṭhā pañcadaśa smṛtāḥ
translated: For a moment, a moment is equal to a wink, and a wink is equal to fifteen human eye-blinks.

analyzed: nava kṣaṇaḥ tu pañjā eva viṃśat kāṣṭhā tu te trayaḥ

analyzed: prasthā sapta dakāḥ ca eva lavaḥ smṛtaḥ  lavāḥ triṃśat kalāḥ jñeyāḥ muhūrttaḥ triṃśataḥ kalāḥ

analyzed: muhūrttāḥ tu punar triṃśat ahorātram iti sthitiḥ
translated: and thirty muhurtas as one day and night, this is the rule.

original: ahorātraṃ kalānāṃ tu adhikāni śatāni ṣaṭ /
analyzed: ahorātram kalānām tu adhikāni śatāni ṣaḍ
translated: Day and night together have six hundred and twenty-four kalas.

original: tāścaiva saṃkhyāyā jñeyāścandrādityagatiryathā // / / //🔽nimeṣā daśapañcaivaṃ kāṣṭhā stāstriṃśataḥ kalā /
analyzed: tāḥ ca eva saṃkhyāyāḥ jñeyāḥ candra āditya gatiḥ yathā  nimeṣāḥ daśa pañca evam kāṣṭhāḥ stāḥ triṃśataḥ kalā

original: triṃśatkalā muhūrttaṃ tu daśabhāgaṃ kalā smṛtam // / / //
analyzed: triṃśat kalā muhūrttam tu daśa bhāgam kalā smṛtam
translated: Thirty kalas make one muhurta, and ten parts of a kala are said to be one lava.

analyzed: catvāriṃśat kalāḥ pañca muhūrttaḥ iti saṃjñitaḥ
translated: Forty-five kalas are designated as one muhurta.

analyzed: muhūrttāḥ ca lavāḥ ca api pramāṇa jñaiḥ prakalpitāḥ
translated: Muhurtas and lavas are determined by those who know the measurements.

analyzed: tathā anena aṃbhasaḥ cāpim palāni atha trayodaśa
translated: Similarly, thirteen palas of water

original: māgadhenaiva mānena jalaprastho vidhīyate // / / //🔽ete vārāplutaprasthāścatvāro nālikoccayaḥ /
analyzed: māgadhena eva mānena jala prasthaḥ vidhīyate  ete vārāpluta prasthāḥ catvāraḥ nālikā uccayaḥ
translated: are prescribed as one jalaprastha by the Magadha measure.🔽These four - vara, apluta, prastha, and nalika -

analyzed: hema māṣaiḥ kṛta chidraḥ caturbhiḥ catur aṅgulaiḥ
translated: are made with four holes of four fingers each by golden masha coins.

original: samāhani ca rātrau ca muhūrttā vai dvinālikāḥ /
analyzed: sama ahani ca rātrau ca muhūrttāḥ vai dvi nālikāḥ
translated: In the day and night, the muhurtas are two nalikas each.

analyzed: raveḥ gati viśeṣeṇa sarveṣu eteṣu nityaśas
translated: Due to the special motion of the sun, all of these occur daily.

analyzed: adhikam ṣaṭśatam yat ca kalānām pravidhīyate
translated: The additional six hundred kalas that are prescribed,

analyzed: tat ahar mānuṣam jñeyam nākṣatram tu daśa adhikam
translated: should be known as one human day, but ten more for the lunar day.

original: sāvanena tu mānena abdo 'yaṃ mānuṣaḥ smṛtaḥ /
analyzed: sāvanena tu mānena abdaḥ yam mānuṣaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: This is known as one human year according to the Sāvana reckoning.

analyzed: etat divyam ahorātram iti śāstra viniścayaḥ
translated: This is the divine day and night, as determined by the scriptures.

analyzed: ahlānena tu yā saṃkhyā māsa ṛtu ayana vārṣikī
translated: The enumeration of months, seasons, solstices, and years by the Ahalyā reckoning,

analyzed: tadā baddham idam jñānam saṃjñayā hi upalakṣitam
translated: that knowledge is bound by convention, indicated by the name.

analyzed: kalānām tu parimāṇam kalā iti abhidhīyate
translated: The measure of the kalās is said to be the kalās.

original: yadaho brahmaṇaḥ proktaṃ divyā koṭī tu sā smṛtā // / / //
analyzed: yat ahar brahmaṇaḥ proktam divyā koṭī tu sā smṛtā
translated: That is said to be the day of Brahmā, which is remembered as a divine koṭi.

analyzed: śatānām ca sahasrāṇi daśa dvi guṇitāni ca
translated: Ten times one thousand, and twenty times one thousand,

original: navatiṃ ca sahasrāṇi tathaivānyāni yāni tu // / / //
analyzed: navatim ca sahasrāṇi tathā eva anyāni yāni tu
translated: and ninety times one thousand, and whatever other

analyzed: etat śrutvā tu ṛṣayaḥ vismayam parama adbhutam
translated: Having heard this, the sages were amazed at the highest wonder,

analyzed: saṃkhyā saṃbhajanam jñānam apṛcchan sutarām tadā
translated: and then asked about the knowledge of the calculation of numbers.

analyzed: ṛṣayaḥ ūcuḥ
translated: The sages said:

analyzed: saṃprakālana mānam tu mānuṣeṇa eva sammatam
translated: The reckoning of time is accepted by humans themselves.

original: mānena śrotumicchāmaḥ saṃkṣepārthapādākṣaram // / / //🔽teṣāṃ śrutvā sa devastu vāyurlokahite rataḥ /
analyzed: mānena śrotum icchāmaḥ saṃkṣepa artha pāda akṣaram  teṣām śrutvā sa devaḥ tu vāyuḥ loka hite rataḥ
translated: We wish to hear the reckoning in terms of the shortest unit of time, in brief.🔽Having heard their words, that god Vāyu, devoted to the welfare of the world,

analyzed: saṃkṣepāt divya cakṣuṣṭvāt provāca vacanam prabhuḥ
translated: the lord, with divine insight, spoke in brief.

original: ete rātryahanī pūrvaṃ kīrtite tviha laukike /
analyzed: ete rātri ahanī pūrvam kīrtite tu iha laukike
translated: These days and nights have been described to you as they are known in the world.

original: tāsāṃ saṃkhyātha varṣāgraṃ brāhme vakṣyāmyahaḥkṣaye // / / //🔽koḍīśatāni catvāri varṣāṇi mānuṣāṇi tu /
analyzed: tāsām saṃkhyā atha varṣa agram brāhme vakṣyāmi ahar kṣaye  koḍī śatāni catvāri varṣāṇi mānuṣāṇi tu
translated: Now, at the end of a day of Brahmā, I shall tell you the number of years.🔽Four hundred and thirty-two crores of years,🔽and twenty-eight thousand years, as counted by the twice-born.

original: dvātriṃśacca tathā koṭyaḥ saṃkhyātāḥ saṃkhyayā dvijaiḥ // / / //🔽tathā śatasahasrāṇi ekonanavatiḥ punaḥ /
analyzed: dvātriṃśat ca tathā koṭyaḥ saṃkhyātāḥ saṃkhyayā dvijaiḥ  tathā śata sahasrāṇi ekonanavatiḥ punar
translated: And ninety-nine hundred thousand,

original: aśītiśca sahasrāṇi eṣa kālaḥ plavasya tu // / / //
analyzed: aśītiḥ ca sahasrāṇi eṣa kālaḥ plavasya tu
translated: and eighty thousand years - this is the duration of the Pralaya.

analyzed: mānuṣa ākhyena saṃkhyātaḥ kālaḥ hi ābhūtasam plavaḥ
translated: The duration of the Pralaya is counted in human years.

analyzed: sapta sūrya pradagdheṣu tadā lokeṣu teṣu vai
translated: When the worlds are scorched by the seven suns,

original: mahābhūtaṣu līyanta prajāḥ sarvāścaturvidhāḥ // / / //🔽salilenāplute loke naṣṭe sthāvarajaṅgame // / / //🔽vinivṛtte ca saṃhāre upaśānte prajāpatau /

translated: all the four types of beings merge into the great elements.🔽When the world is flooded with water and all moving and unmoving beings are destroyed,🔽when the destruction is over and the Lord of beings is at peace,

analyzed: nirāloke pradagdhe tu naiśena tamasā vṛte  īśvara dhiṣṭhite tu asmin hi ekārmave kila
translated: when it is without light, burnt by the darkness of night, and enveloped in darkness,🔽then, it is said, this world is under the control of the Lord.

analyzed: tāvat ekārmave jñeyam yāvat āsīt ahar prabhoḥ
translated: Then, it should be known that it is the Ekārṇava (Single Ocean) for as long as it is the day of the Lord.

analyzed: rātriḥ tu salila avasthā nivṛttau vā api ahar smṛtam
translated: Night is said to be the state of water, and day is remembered as the state of withdrawal.

analyzed: ahorātraḥ tathā eva asya krameṇa parivartate
translated: In this way, day and night revolve in sequence.

analyzed: ābhūtasaṃplavaḥ hi eṣa ahorātraḥ smṛtaḥ prabhoḥ
translated: This day and night is known as the dissolution of all elements, the day of the Lord.

analyzed: trailokye yāni sattvāni gatimanti dhruvāṇi ca
translated: All the moving and unmoving beings in the three worlds

analyzed: ābhūtebhyaḥ pralīyante tasmāt ābhūtasaṃplavaḥ
translated: dissolve into the elements, hence it is called the dissolution of all elements.

analyzed: atītāḥ vartamānāḥ ca tathā eva anāgatāḥ prajāḥ
translated: The past, present, and future generations

analyzed: divya saṃkhyā prasaṃkhyātāḥ aparārdha guṇīkṛtāḥ
translated: are reckoned as divine numbers, multiplied by the second half.

analyzed: parārddham dviguṇam ca api parama āyuḥ
translated: The supreme lifespan is declared to be twice the parardha.

analyzed: etāvān sthiti kālaḥ tu hi ajasya iha prajāpateḥ
translated: This is the duration of existence of the unborn Prajapati here.

analyzed: sthiti antam pratisargaḥ ca brahmaṇaḥ parameṣṭhinaḥ
translated: From the end of the creation to the end of the dissolution, of Brahma, the supreme lord.

analyzed: yathā vāyu pravegena dīpa arciḥ upaśamyati
translated: Just as the flame of a lamp is extinguished by the force of the wind,

analyzed: tathā eva pratisargeṇa brahmā samupaśāmyati
translated: in the same way, Brahma is extinguished by the dissolution.

analyzed: tathā sva pratisaṃsṛṣṭe mahat ādau maheśvare
translated: Similarly, when the great elements etc. dissolve into Mahesvara,

analyzed: mahat pralīyate vyakte guṇa sāmyam tatas bhavet
translated: the great one dissolves into the manifest, and then there is equality of the gunas.

analyzed: iti eṣa vaḥ samākhyātaḥ mayā hi ā bhūtasaṃplavaḥ
translated: Thus have I described to you the dissolution of all created beings.

analyzed: brahmanaimittikaḥ hi eṣa saṃprakṣālana saṃyamaḥ
translated: This is the dissolution of all things brought about by Brahma, and this is the purification and restraint of all things.

original: samāsena samākhyāto bhūyaḥ kiṃ varmayāmi vaḥ // / / //
analyzed: samāsena samākhyātaḥ bhūyas kim vaḥ
translated: I have described to you this in brief. What more do you wish to hear?

analyzed: yaḥ idam dhārayet nityam śṛṇuyāt vā api abhīkṣṇaśas
translated: He who always remembers this, or hears it frequently,

analyzed: kīrttayet varṇayet vā api mahatīm siddhim āpnuyāt
translated: or recites it or explains it, attains great success.

original: iti śrībrahmāṇḍe mahāpurāṇe vāyuprokte uttarabhāge caturtha upasaṃhārapāde ābhūtasaṃplavākhyavarṇanaṃ nāma prathamo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī brahmāṇḍe mahāpurāṇe vāyuprokte uttara bhāge caturthe upasaṃhāra pāde ābhūtasaṃplavākhyavarṇanam nāma prathamaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the first chapter on the description of the dissolution of all beings in the fourth concluding section of the northern branch in the great Purana called Brahma-Andam narrated by Vayu.

analyzed: vāyuḥ uvāca  asādhāraṇa vṛttaiḥ tu hutaśeṣa ādibhiḥ janaiḥ
translated: Vayu said:🔽By those who have extraordinary conduct, by those who have remnants of oblations, and by those who have subtle vision,

analyzed: dharmāḥ vaiśeṣikāḥ ca eva ācīrṇāḥ sūkṣma darśibhiḥ
translated: the special Dharmas have been practiced.

analyzed: te devaiḥ saha tiṣṭhanti mahar loka nivāsinaḥ
translated: They dwell with the gods in the world of Maharloka.

analyzed: caturdaśā ete manavaḥ kīrtitāḥ kīrti varddhanāḥ
translated: These fourteen Manus, who increase fame, have been described.

analyzed: atītāḥ varttamānāḥ ca tathā eva anāgatāḥ ca ye
translated: Those who have passed, those who are present, and those who will come in the future,

analyzed: devāḥ ca ṛṣayaḥ ca eva manavaḥ pitaraḥ tathā
translated: the gods, the sages, the Manus, and the ancestors,🔽have been described by me in the Purana.

analyzed: sarve hi uktāḥ mayā atīta mahar lokam samāśritāḥ
translated: All of them, I have said, reside in the world of Maharloka, beyond the world of Brahmapurohita.

analyzed: brāhmaṇaiḥ kṣatriyaiḥ vaiśyaiḥ dhārmikaiḥ sahitaiḥ saraiḥ

analyzed: mahā iti mahar lokaḥ tatas bhavat

analyzed: vinivṛtta adhikāraṇām devānām tatra vai kṣayaḥ

analyzed: ye te svāyaṃbhuva ādyāḥ hi purastāt parikīrttitāḥ

analyzed: ūrdhvañca adhas ca tiryak ca dodhavīti diśaḥ daśa

analyzed: arūpam arasa sparśam agandham na ca mūrtimat

analyzed: sarvam āpūrayat śabdaiḥ su mahat tat prakāśate

analyzed: evam jñātvā śuciḥ bhūtvā jñānāt vai vipramucyate

analyzed: muktaḥ guṇa śarīreṇa praṇādyena tu sarvaśas

analyzed: na anyat śarīram ādatte dagdhe vīje yathā aṅkuraḥ

analyzed: jñānī ca sarva saṃsāra avijña śārīra mānasaḥ

analyzed: asadbhāvaḥ jñeyam sadbhāvaḥ satya mucyate

analyzed: a nāma rūpam kṣetrajña nāma rūpam pracakṣate

analyzed: kṣetrajñaḥ smaryate tasmāt kṣetram tad jñaiḥ vibhāṣyate

analyzed: kṣapaṇāt kāraṇāt ca eva kṣata trāṇāt tathā eva ca
translated: Because of destruction, being a cause, protecting what is destroyed, and also

translated: The great elements up to the specific, all of the same nature, are distinguished.🔽That is characterized by modification. He enters the perishable.🔽But because it again flows after that modification,

analyzed: tasmāt ca kāraṇāt ca eva jñaram iti abhidhīyate
translated: and also because of that cause, it is called perishable.

analyzed: duḥkha trāṇāt punar ca api kṣetram iti abhidhīyate

analyzed: sukha duḥkham ahaṃbhāvāt bhojyam iti abhidhīyate

analyzed: acetana tvāt viṣayaḥ tad vidharmā vibhuḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: It is remembered as the all-pervading, having the nature of an object, because of being insentient.

original: na kṣīyate na kṣarati vikāraprasṛtaṃ tu tat /
analyzed: na kṣīyate na kṣarati vikāra prasṛtam tu tat
translated: It is not destroyed, it does not decay, but it spreads out in modifications.

translated: It is called imperishable because it is not diminished, and also because of that.🔽Because he lies down in the beginning, therefore he is called Purusha.

analyzed: pura pratyayikaḥ yasmāt puruṣa iti abhidhīyate
translated: Because he is the cause of the city, therefore he is called Purusha.

analyzed: puruṣam kathayasva atha kathitaḥ jñaiḥ vibhāṣyate

analyzed: asti na asti iti saḥ nyaḥ vā baddhaḥ muktaḥ gataḥ sthitaḥ

analyzed: nairhetukāt tu anirdeśyāt ahar tasmin na vidyate

analyzed: śuddha tvāt na tu dṛśyaḥ vai draṣṭṛ tvāt sama darśanaḥ
translated: He is not seen because of his purity, he is the seer, he is the equal vision.

analyzed: ātma pratyaya kāri tvāt anyūnam vā api ahetukam
translated: Because of his being the cause of self-confidence, he is neither less nor causeless.

analyzed: bhāva grāhyam anumānāt cintayan na pramuhyate
translated: Thinking that the object of existence is to be inferred, he does not become confused.

analyzed: yadā paśyati jñātāram śānta artham darśana ātmakam
translated: When he sees the knower, the peaceful object, the essence of vision,

analyzed: dṛśya adṛśyeṣu nirdeśyam tadā tat durddharam varam
translated: The indescribable among the visible and invisible, then that supreme state is difficult to attain.

analyzed: vijñātā na ca dṛśyeta vṛthaktvena iha sarvaśas
translated: The knower should not be seen at all as a mere void.

analyzed: svena ātmanā tathā ātmānam kāraṇa ātmā niyacchati

analyzed: ātmā vā sa nirātmā vā vā

analyzed: apratarkyam acintya tvāt avāḥ yetvāt ca sarvaśas

analyzed: na ālapya vacasā tattvam a prāpya manasā saha

analyzed: vyapeta sukha duḥkhe ca niruddhe śāntim āgate

analyzed: nirātmake punar tasmin vācya avācyam na vidyate

analyzed: etau saṃhāra vistārau vyakta avyaktau tatas punar

analyzed: sṛjyate grasate ca eva vyaktau paryavatiṣṭhate

analyzed: kṣetrajña dhiṣṭhitam sarvam punar sarge pravarttate

analyzed: adhiṣṭhānam prapadyeta tasya ante buddhi pūrvakam

analyzed: sādharmya vaidharmya kṛtaḥ saṃyogaḥ viditaḥ tayoḥ

analyzed: anādimān ca saṃyogaḥ mahā puruṣa jaḥ smṛtaḥ

analyzed: iti śrī brahmāṇḍe mahāpurāṇe vāyu prokte uttara bhāge caturthe upasaṃhāra pāde pratisargaḥ nāma tṛtīyaḥ dhyāyaḥ

analyzed: guṇa mātra ātmakau eva dharma adharmaum parasparam
translated: Dharma and Adharma, which consist of mere qualities, mutually

analyzed: tatas tu paramā śaktiḥ bhūta saṃdha sahāyinī

analyzed: sarva agha mocinī śaktiḥ sarva duḥkha vimocinī

Pacifying all death, destroying all obstacles,

analyzed: sarva aṅga sundarī ca eva sarva saubhāgya dāyinī

The goddess full of all knowledge, the destroyer of all diseases,

analyzed: sarva ādhāra svarūpā ca sarva pāpa harā tathā

The goddess full of all bliss, the embodiment of all protection,

translated: And the tenth one should be known as the bestower of all desired fruits.🔽Having assigned the Mistress of the Wheel and offered the Wheel, pervading the body,

analyzed: prāk vāma ādyāḥ ca vinyasya pakṣiṇī ādyāḥ tatas sudhīḥ

analyzed: dakṣe tu cibuke kaṇṭhe stane nābhau ca pārśvayoḥ

translated: Kāmeśvarī should be known as Para, Mohinī, and Vimalā.

analyzed: aruṇā jayinī paścāt tathā sarveśvarī matā

original: kaulinīti samuktāni tāsāṃ nāmāni sūribhiḥ // / / //🔽cakreśvarīṃ nyaseccakraṃ samarpya vyāpya varṣmaṇi /

translated: The wise ones have declared their names as Kaulini, etc.🔽Having offered the wheel to the goddess of the wheel, the wise one should place it in the pervasion of the body.

original: hṛdi trikoṇaṃ saṃbhāvya dikṣu prāgāditaḥ kramāt // / / //
analyzed: hṛdi trikoṇam saṃbhāvya dikṣu prāc ādeḥ kramāt
translated: Having visualized the triangle in the heart, in the directions starting from the east in order,

translated: Outside that, the wise one should place the set of four weapons.🔽In the southeast and other directions, one should place the set of four pedestals in the middle.

analyzed: madhya vṛttam nyasitvā ca nityā ṣoḍaśakam nyaset
translated: Having placed the central circle, one should place the sixteen eternal ones.

original: kāmeśvarī tathā nityā nityā ca bhagamālinī // / / //
analyzed: kāmeśvarī tathā nityā nityā ca bhagamālinī
translated: Then the eternal Kāmeśvarī, the eternal Bhagamālinī,

original: nityaklinnā tathā nityā nityā bheruṇḍinī matā /
translated: The eternal Nityaklinnā, and the eternal Bheruṇḍinī are considered.
The eternal Vahnivāsini, and the eternal Mahāvajreśvarī,

original: nityā ca dūtī nityā ca tvaritā tu tataḥ param /
analyzed: nityā ca dūtī nityā ca tvaritā tu tatas param
translated: The eternal Dūtī, the eternal Tvaritā, and then Aghorā,

original: kulasundarikā nityā kulyā nityā tataḥ param // / / //
analyzed: kulasundarikā nityā kulyā nityā tatas param
translated: Kula Sundarika, Nitya, Kulyanitya,🔽Nitya, Nilapataka, Nitya, Vijaya,

analyzed: nityā nīlapatākā ca nityā tu vijayā parā  tatas tu maṅgalā ca eva nitya pūrvā pracakṣyate
translated: Mangala, Nitya, Purva,

analyzed: prabhāmālinikā nityā citrā nityā tathā eva ca
translated: Prabhamalinika, Nitya, Citra,

analyzed: etāḥ trikoṇa antareṇa pādataḥ hṛdi vinyaset
translated: These should be placed in the heart, at the feet, within the triangle.

analyzed: nityā pramodinī ca eva nityā tripurasundarī
translated: Nitya, Pramo-dini, Nitya, Tripura Sundari,

analyzed: tad madhye vinyaset devīm akhaṇḍa jagat ātmikām
translated: In the middle of that, one should place the Goddess, who is the undivided Self of the universe.

original: cakreśvarīṃ hṛdi nyasya kṛtvā cakraṃ samuddhṛtam /
analyzed: cakreśvarīm hṛdi nyasya kṛtvā cakram samuddhṛtam
translated: Having placed the Mistress of the Wheel in the heart, having raised the Wheel,

analyzed: pradarśya mudrām yoni ākhyām sarvānanda manum japet
translated: Having displayed the Yoni Mudra, one should meditate on the mantra of all bliss.

original: ityātmanastu cakrasya cakradevī bhaviṣyati // / / //🔽iti śrībrahmāṇḍamahāpurāṇe uttarabhāge hayagrīvāgastyasaṃvāde lalitopākhyāne catuścatvāriṃśo 'dhyāyaḥ🔽samāptaṃ lalitopākhyānam /
analyzed: iti ātmanaḥ tu cakrasya cakra devī bhaviṣyati  iti śrī brahmāṇḍa mahāpurāṇe uttara bhāge hayagrīva agastya saṃvāde lalitā upākhyāne catuścatvāriṃśaḥ dhyāyaḥ  samāptam lalitā upākhyānam
translated: Thus, the Goddess of the Wheel will be in one's own Wheel.

analyzed: śrīmat pratāpa gaḍha pattana madhya vartti śrī rāma pūrvakagaḍha abhidha vāsinā idam
translated: Thus ends the forty-fourth chapter in the Uttarakhaṇḍa of the Skanda-Purāṇa, in the dialogue between Haya-ग्रीव and Agastya, in the story of Lalitā.

original: saṃśodhitaṃ nikhilamānyapurāṇakaṃ yad brahmāṇḍasaṃjñamiha tadviduṣāṃ mude 'stu
analyzed: saṃśodhitam nikhilam ānya purāṇakam yat brahmāṇḍa saṃjñam iha tat viduṣām mude stu
translated: May this entire universe known as Brahmanda, purified of all impurities, be for the delight of the learned.

analyzed: raghunāthena idam yat kvacid asti ha api asaṃśuddham
translated: Whatever is found here by Raghunatha to be impure,

analyzed: saṃśodhitam api dayayā tat kṣantavyam hi aśeṣeṇa
translated: even if purified, should be forgiven entirely out of compassion.

analyzed: om namaḥ bhagavate vāsudevāya
translated: Om, salutations to Lord Vāsudeva.

analyzed: rāmāya namaḥ
translated: Salutations to Rāma.

analyzed: samāptam idam brahmāṇḍa mahā purāṇam
translated: This Brahmanda Mahāpurāṇa is complete.
